oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1st Report of the Working Group on Standard Development
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Walkenhorst, Michael
Sundrum, Albert
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Health and welfare
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The initial meeting of the working group on standard development took place at the 1st SAFO-Workshop, September 2003, in Florence. In accordance with the main topic of the Workshop, the discussion was primarily focused on the relationship between socio-economic aspects of the standards and the issue of animal health and food safety in organic farming. The report cover the additional issues discussed in the 1st Working Group meeting in Florence.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: SAFO Sustaining Animal Health and Food Safety in Organic Farming. A European Commission funded Concerted Action Project
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Walkenhorst, Michael and Sundrum, Albert (2003) 1st Report of the Working Group on Standard Development. In: Hovi, M.; Martini, A. and Padel, S. (Eds.) Socio-economic aspects of animal health and food safety in organic farming systems. Proceedings of the 1st SAFO Workshop. 5.-7. September 2003, Florence, Italy. SAFO Sustaining Animal Health and Food Safety in Organic Farming. A European Commission funded Concerted Action Project, pp. 269-273.
